analyzed: bdag gis kyang ni yang dag bshad ;

translated: Thus have I heard at one time

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal /

original: mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na /
analyzed: mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na /
translated: in Anāthapiṇḍada's park,

original: dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' rab tu mang po dag dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi'o //
analyzed: dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' rab tu mang po dag dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi'o //
translated: together with a great saṅgha of 1,250 monks and many bodhisattvas. This is the nidāna.

original: ci'i phyir rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal na bzhugs she na /
translated: Why was he dwelling in the Jeta Grove?

original: chos 'di khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba rnams kyi yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'di khyim gyi gnas nas mngon par 'byung ba rnams kyi yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this Dharma is taught for those who have gone forth from the home life.

original: de bas na dge slong rnams la bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de bas na dge slong rnams la bka' stsal te /
translated: Therefore, it was addressed to the monks.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyis chos 'di bsgrub nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyis chos 'di bsgrub nus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs so //
translated: It was taught in order to show that those who have gone forth are able to practice this Dharma.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po 'di grangs kyi phal che ba nyid la bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po 'di grangs kyi phal che ba nyid la bstan pa ste /
translated: The great assembly of monks is taught to be the majority in number.

original: de ni dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dge slong stong nyis brgya lnga bcu zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: That is stated as “one thousand two hundred and fifty monks.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal ba /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag ces bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag ces bya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Monks!” and “Blessed One!”

original: dge slong dag bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: dge slong dag bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The monks listened to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said this to them:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos bzhi po 'di dag / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gi phyir yang yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di ci'i phyir brtsams she na zhes bya ba ni ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos bzhi po 'di dag / ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gi phyir yang yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di ci'i phyir brtsams she na zhes bya ba ni ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go
translated: Why was this sutra composed, “The bodhisattva-mahāsattva should not abandon these four dharmas even at the cost of his life”? This means “for what purpose”?

original: // dgos pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs la mgo rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / bag med pa rnams yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: // dgos pa ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs la mgo rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / bag med pa rnams yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The purpose is stated as follows: in order to teach correctly to those who have entered the Great Vehicle but are confused about the means of attaining unsurpassed enlightenment, in order to cause the heedless to take up [the path],

original: kun tu zhum pa rnams yang dag par zhugs par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: kun tu zhum pa rnams yang dag par zhugs par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: in order to encourage those who are completely discouraged to engage [in the path], and in order to delight those who are correctly engaged [in the path].

original: des ni dgos pa bzhi bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni dgos pa bzhi bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows the four purposes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang @67b dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang @67b dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'o //
translated: It is the correct teaching, the correct instigation, the correct encouragement, and the correct delight.

original: gang dag la yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: gang dag la yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: With regard to those for whom there is the correct teaching,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs la mgo rmongs pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs la mgo rmongs pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it says, “those who are confused about the means of attaining unsurpassed enlightenment.”

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub ste /
translated: Unsurpassed enlightenment is the enlightenment of a Buddha.

original: de thob par bya ba'i thabs la gang dag mgo rmongs pa de dag la yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i thabs la gang dag mgo rmongs pa de dag la yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the sake of correctly teaching those who are confused about the means of attaining that.

original: gang dag thob par bya ba'i thabs mthong yang bag med de mi bsgrubs pas bag med pa de dag yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slong du gzhug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang dag thob par bya ba'i thabs mthong yang bag med de mi bsgrubs pas bag med pa de dag yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni slong du gzhug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who see the means of attaining it but do not practice it because of heedlessness, for the sake of correctly instigating them—that is, for the sake of instigating them to practice.

original: gang dag yang dag par zhugs kyang le lo che ba'i phyir zhan bzhin du 'jug pa de dag ni kun tu zhum pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag yang dag par zhugs kyang le lo che ba'i phyir zhan bzhin du 'jug pa de dag ni kun tu zhum pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who are engaged in the correct practice but who are weak, because of their great laziness, are called “timid.”

original: kun tu zhum pa de dag kyang yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus cher zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun tu zhum pa de dag kyang yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus cher zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to encourage those who are timid, means in order to increase their effort.

original: gang dag brtson 'grus brtsams te chos 'di dag la gnas pa de dag ni yang dag par zhugs pa rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag brtson 'grus brtsams te chos 'di dag la gnas pa de dag ni yang dag par zhugs pa rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who have begun to make effort and who abide in these teachings are called “those who are correctly engaged.”

original: yang dag par zhugs pa de dag yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa de dag yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to delight those who are correctly engaged, means

original: dga' ba'i bye brag skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dga' ba'i bye brag skyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in order to generate a special joy.

original: dgos pa 'di dag ni mdo sde thams cad la yang ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa 'di dag ni mdo sde thams cad la yang ci rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: These purposes apply to all the sūtras, as appropriate.

original: ci'i phyir bzhi zhes grangs mdzad snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzhi zhes grangs mdzad snyam pa la /
translated: Why are there four?

original: bzhi zhes grangs smos pa ni rgya che bar dogs nas de dag nyan mi 'dod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos pa ni blo zhan pa gang dag rgya che ba la mgo rmongs par gyur pa de dag la grangs smos pa med na
analyzed: bzhi zhes grangs smos pa ni rgya che bar dogs nas de dag nyan mi 'dod pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos pa ni blo zhan pa gang dag rgya che ba la mgo rmongs par gyur pa de dag la grangs smos pa med na
translated: Those of weak intellect who are confused about the vastness would not listen to the Dharma if the number were not mentioned.

original: rgya che bar dogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: rgya che bar dogs pa skye'o //
translated: They would be afraid of the vastness.

original: dogs pa des de dag chos de la nyan mi 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dogs pa des de dag chos de la nyan mi 'dod pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because of that fear, they would not want to listen to that Dharma.

original: de bas na de spang ba'i phyir grangs smos pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bas na de spang ba'i phyir grangs smos pa mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the number is mentioned in order to avoid that.

original: rgyu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second reason is:🔽because the number is mentioned, it is easy to remember.

original: grangs smos na bde blag tu dran pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos pa ni chos gang dag grangs smos pa de dag bde blag tu zin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du na sems rnam par 'khrugs par 'gyur bas rnam grangs smos so //
analyzed: grangs smos na bde blag tu dran pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos pa ni chos gang dag grangs smos pa de dag bde blag tu zin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du na sems rnam par 'khrugs par 'gyur bas rnam grangs smos so //
translated: The Dharma that is mentioned by number is easily grasped. Otherwise, the mind would be disturbed, so the enumeration is mentioned.

original: rgyu gsum pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum pa ste /
translated: The third reason is:

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i bzod pa dang / nges pa gnyis dgos pa gcig pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa ni gal te bzhi zhes grangs ma smos na bzod pa dang / nges pa gnyis mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //🔽ci'i phyir de gnyis @68a * //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i bzod pa dang / nges pa gnyis dgos pa gcig pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhes smos pa ni gal te bzhi zhes grangs ma smos na bzod pa dang / nges pa gnyis mi rtogs par 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir de gnyis @68a * //
translated: If the number four is not stated, acceptance and ascertainment would not be understood.

original: tha mi dad ce na /
analyzed: tha mi dad ce na /
translated: Why are those two not different?

original: dgos pa gcig pas zhes smos te /
analyzed: dgos pa gcig pas zhes smos te /
translated: The reason because they have the same purpose is stated.

original: dgos pa gcig pa'i phyir de gnyis tha mi dad par 'dod do //
analyzed: dgos pa gcig pa'i phyir de gnyis tha mi dad par 'dod do //
translated: Because they have the same purpose, those two are considered not different.

original: de thob par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir grangs smos par mdzad do //
analyzed: de thob par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir grangs smos par mdzad do //
translated: The number is stated in order to prevent their non-attainment.

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs mang yang zhes bya ba ni gang dag theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs mang yang zhes bya ba ni gang dag theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa ste /
translated: For those who have set out in the Great Vehicle, there are many synonyms, such as those who have set out in the Great Vehicle and so on.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la zhugs pa de dag la ming mang yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la zhugs pa de dag la ming mang yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Those who have generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and entered the six perfections, for them there are many names, such as🔽 those who have set out in the Great Vehicle and so on.

original: dper na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
analyzed: dper na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' che //
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being,

original: blo dang ldan pa gsal ba'i mchog /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa gsal ba'i mchog /
translated: The wise one, the best of the clear-sighted,

original: rgyal sras rgyal ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rgyal sras rgyal ba nyid dang ni //
translated: The son of the Victor, the Victor himself,🔽The sprout of the Victor, the basis of the Victor,

original: rgyal gzhi rgyal ba'i myu gu dang // rtsal dang ldan pa ngo mtshar ba //
analyzed: rgyal gzhi rgyal ba'i myu gu dang // rtsal dang ldan pa ngo mtshar ba //
translated: The one endowed with power, the wondrous one,

original: de dpon grags pa chen po dang // thugs rje ldan dang bsod nams che //
analyzed: de dpon grags pa chen po dang // thugs rje ldan dang bsod nams che //
translated: The one with great fame, the one with compassion, the one with great merit,

original: dbang phyug de bzhin chos can no //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug de bzhin chos can no // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The one with power, and the one with the Dharma.

original: de ltar rnam grangs mang na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes ming gnyis smos she na /
analyzed: de ltar rnam grangs mang na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes ming gnyis smos she na /
translated: If there are many such synonyms, why are two names mentioned, “bodhisattva” and “great being”?

original: de'i phyir rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said “for three reasons.”

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / khong du chud pas so //
analyzed: mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / khong du chud pas so //
translated: They are interest, application, and comprehension.

original: mos pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mos pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by interest?

original: shes bya zab mo la mos pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de la zab mo ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes bya zab mo la mos pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de la zab mo ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: Because of interest in the profound knowable, one is called a bodhisattva. The profound refers to the selflessness of persons and things.

original: de rtogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste de la mos pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste de la mos pa'o //
translated: The one who realizes that is a bodhisattva, and he is devoted to it.

original: sems dpa' ni de la sems pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni de la sems pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: A bodhisattva is so called because he is intent on that.🔽He is called a great being because he is devoted to the great power of the bodhisattva.

original: mthu chen po la mos pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba de la mthu chen po ni gang su'i lungm bu re re nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ma 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthu chen po la mos pa'i phyir sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba de la mthu chen po ni gang su'i lungm bu re re nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ma 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The great power is that by which he can mention the kalpas of the destruction and evolution of many buddha-fields in each instant.

original: de'i phyir de la mos pas na sems can de che bas sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la mos pas na sems can de che bas sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: Therefore, because he is devoted to that, he is a great being because he is a great being.

original: sbyor bas ji lta bu zhe na /🔽bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir rab tu brtson pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: sbyor bas ji lta bu zhe na / bdag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir rab tu brtson pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste ;
translated: How is he a bodhisattva by application?🔽He is called a bodhisattva because he is intent on supreme perfect enlightenment for the sake of all beings.

original: byang chub la rab tu brtson pa'i sems can ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la rab tu brtson pa'i sems can ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: A bodhisattva is so called because he is intent on enlightenment for the sake of beings.

original: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: For the sake of completely protecting all sentient beings from suffering is to be supplied with the great bodhisattva who is striving.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po mya ngan las zlo pa'i phyir rab tu brtson pa'i @68b sems can ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po mya ngan las zlo pa'i phyir rab tu brtson pa'i @68b sems can ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The sentient being who is striving to deliver the great multitude of sentient beings is called a great being in the sense of the derivation of the term.

original: khong du chud pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khong du chud pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the understanding?

original: stobs gnyis kyis byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa chos gnyis dang ldan na byang chub rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stobs gnyis kyis byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa chos gnyis dang ldan na byang chub rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because enlightenment is realized through two powers means that because one who has set out in the Great Vehicle possesses two qualities, one realizes enlightenment.

original: de bas na gnyis dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who possesses the two is called a bodhisattva great being.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: blo'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: blo'i stobs dang / brtson 'grus kyi stobs te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The power of mind and the power of effort are mentioned.

original: blo nyid dang / brtson 'grus nyid stobs zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
analyzed: blo nyid dang / brtson 'grus nyid stobs zhes tshig rnam par sbyor ro //
translated: The word “power” is to be resolved as “mind” and “effort.”

original: blo de dang ldan pa'i sems can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi zil gyis mi non pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: blo de dang ldan pa'i sems can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi zil gyis mi non pas byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: A being who has that mind is a bodhisattva, because he is not overcome by adverse elements.

original: brtson 'grus ni che bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas de dang ldan pa'i sems can ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni che bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pas de dang ldan pa'i sems can ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since effort is the cause of greatness, a being who has that is called a “great bodhisattva.”

original: stobs gnyis kyis byang chub rtogs par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: stobs gnyis kyis byang chub rtogs par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known that enlightenment is realized by means of the two powers?

original: mi shes pa dang / brtson 'grus chung dus ni byang chub rtogs par mi nus so zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / brtson 'grus chung dus ni byang chub rtogs par mi nus so zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: It is said that enlightenment cannot be realized by one who is ignorant or who has little effort.

original: de bas na de ltar rgyu gsum gyis ming gnyis smos pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar rgyu gsum gyis ming gnyis smos pa mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the two names are mentioned for these three reasons.

original: de ni 'di skad du theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs mang du zin kyang 'dir ji skad smos pa'i mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rnam grangs mang du zin kyang 'dir ji skad smos pa'i mos pa dang / sbyor ba dang / rtogs pa dang ldan pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: This is to be explained as follows: Although there are many enumerations of the Great Vehicle, here the one who is endowed with the aspiration, application, and realization as they have been mentioned is called a bodhisattva.

original: de gnyis ston pa'i phyir smos so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ston pa'i phyir smos so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is in order to teach those two that the verse was composed.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bas ni chos de rnams la rgyun du bya ba nyid ston to zhes bya bas ni chos de dag la rtag tu bsten na ji skad bshad pa bzhin du thob par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya bas ni chos de rnams la rgyun du bya ba nyid ston to zhes bya bas ni chos de dag la rtag tu bsten na ji skad bshad pa bzhin du thob par bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase “should not be abandoned as long as one lives” teaches the constant practice of those teachings. The phrase “if one relies on them always” teaches that one will attain them as they have been explained.

original: yon tan de yang 'og nas tshigs su bcad de /
analyzed: yon tan de yang 'og nas tshigs su bcad de /
translated: And that quality is stated in the verse:

original: mkhas 'dir chos 'di dag la rtag gnas na //
analyzed: mkhas 'dir chos 'di dag la rtag gnas na //
translated: The wise one, always practicing these teachings here,

original: bdud rnams bcom ste byang chub 'tshang rgya'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rnams bcom ste byang chub 'tshang rgya'o // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: conquers the demons and attains enlightenment.

original: srog gi phyir yang zhes bya bas ni gus par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang zhes bya bas ni gus par bya ba nyid de /
translated: The phrase “even at the cost of one’s life” teaches the quality of devotion.

original: gus par bya ba ni chos bzhi po 'di dag la bya bar bstan par sbyar te /
analyzed: gus par bya ba ni chos bzhi po 'di dag la bya bar bstan par sbyar te /
translated: The four qualities are taught as the ones to be revered.

original: bsti stang du bya zhing gus pa dang bcas pas bstan na yon tan rnams thob par bstan to //
analyzed: bsti stang du bya zhing gus pa dang bcas pas bstan na yon tan rnams thob par bstan to //
translated: If one teaches with respect and reverence, one will attain the virtues.🔽Why are they called the four qualities?

original: ci'i phyir chos bzhi zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni bzhi po 'di nyid de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos bzhi zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni bzhi po 'di nyid de zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: They are just these four, that is the meaning.

original: mi nyung mi mang zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: mi nyung mi mang zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: The minimum and maximum are applied.

original: lan du byang chub kyi tshogs kyi bar chad byed pa'i chos bzhi ste zhes bya ba smos te /🔽gang gi phyir byang @69a * //
analyzed: lan du byang chub kyi tshogs kyi bar chad byed pa'i chos bzhi ste zhes bya ba smos te / gang gi phyir byang @69a * //
translated: The answer is: The four qualities that create obstacles to the accumulation of enlightenment.

original: chub sems dpa'i tshogs la bar chad byed pa bzhi kho na ste /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i tshogs la bar chad byed pa bzhi kho na ste /
translated: Because for the bodhisattva, there are just four that create obstacles to the accumulation of enlightenment.🔽There are no more than four, and no less.

original: mi nyung mi mang la de dag gi gnyen por bshad pas bzhi nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi nyung mi mang la de dag gi gnyen por bshad pas bzhi nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: They are explained as the antidotes to those, so they become four.

original: nyung ba yang ma yin mang ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyung ba yang ma yin mang ba yang ma yin no //
translated: There are neither fewer nor more.

original: bar chad byed pa de dag gang yin snyam pa la don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / thabs mi shes pa nyid dang / sems can la mi phyogs pa nyid dang / yul la mngon du phyogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bar chad byed pa de dag gang yin snyam pa la don du mi gnyer ba nyid dang / thabs mi shes pa nyid dang / sems can la mi phyogs pa nyid dang / yul la mngon du phyogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What are those obstacles? The response is: not being interested, not knowing the means, not being oriented toward sentient beings, and being oriented toward objects.

original: de la re zhig don du mi gnyer ba nyid kyi gnyen por ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig don du mi gnyer ba nyid kyi gnyen por ni 'di lta ste /
translated: With regard to that, the antidote to not being interested is stated as follows:

original: dge slong dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji srid 'tsho'i bar du byang chub kyi sems srog gi phyir yang yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji srid 'tsho'i bar du byang chub kyi sems srog gi phyir yang yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Bhikṣus, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should not give up the thought of awakening even for the sake of his life.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni don du gnyer ba'i ngo bo yin pas mi 'dod pa nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni don du gnyer ba'i ngo bo yin pas mi 'dod pa nyid bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the thought of awakening is the essence of being interested, it turns away from what is not desired.

original: thabs mi shes pa nyid kyi gnyen por ni 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: thabs mi shes pa nyid kyi gnyen por ni 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to not knowing the means is stated as follows: A spiritual friend should not be abandoned.

original: de la brten nas thabs shes pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas thabs shes pa nyid thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, on the basis of that, one attains the very wisdom of means.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang sangs rgyas rnams te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang sangs rgyas rnams te /
translated: Therein, the spiritual friend of the bodhisattva is the bodhisattvas and the Buddhas.

original: dper na byang chub sems dpa'i chos smra ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na byang chub sems dpa'i chos smra ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the spiritual friend of the bodhisattva, the Dharma teacher, is the spiritual friend of the bodhisattva, the Blessed Buddhas.

original: sems can la mi phyogs pa nyid kyi gnyen por 'di ltar bzod pa dang / des pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems can la mi phyogs pa nyid kyi gnyen por 'di ltar bzod pa dang / des pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the non-directionality towards sentient beings is stated thus: “one should not abandon patience and gentleness.”

original: de la bzod pa ni pha rol gyi gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa ni pha rol gyi gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa'o //
translated: Therein, patience is the forbearance of harm done by others.

original: des pa ni pha rol la gnod pa mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: des pa ni pha rol la gnod pa mi byed pa ste /
translated: Gentleness is the non-doing of harm to others.

original: bdag gi sems rnam par dag pa dang / gzhan gyi sems rjes su srung ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gi sems rnam par dag pa dang / gzhan gyi sems rjes su srung ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is in relation to one’s own mind and the protection of the minds of others, respectively.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal dang gnod pa 'dod pa'i gnyen pos sems can la mi phyogs pa nyid kyi gnyen por gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal dang gnod pa 'dod pa'i gnyen pos sems can la mi phyogs pa nyid kyi gnyen por gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the remedy for the aversion to sentient beings that is based on the desire for suffering and harm is the remedy for the aversion to sentient beings that is based on the desire for happiness and benefit.

original: yul mngon du phyogs pa'i gnyen por ni 'di ltar dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: yul mngon du phyogs pa'i gnyen por ni 'di ltar dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The remedy for the aversion to sentient beings that is based on the manifestation of objects is stated as follows: “One should not give up living in the forest.”

original: de na bud med kyi gzugs la sogs pa chags par 'gyur ba rnams med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dre ba med pas mngon du phyogs pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de na bud med kyi gzugs la sogs pa chags par 'gyur ba rnams med pa'i phyir ro // 'dre ba med pas mngon du phyogs pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because there are no women, etc., in the forest that could cause one to become attached to form, etc.🔽Thus, the remedy for the aversion to sentient beings that is based on the manifestation of objects is the remedy for the aversion to sentient beings that is based on the manifestation of objects.

original: yang bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi bar @69b chad byed pa'i chos bzhi zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
analyzed: yang bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi bar @69b chad byed pa'i chos bzhi zhes bya bar bsnyegs so //
translated: There are four other types of obstacles to the bodhisattva collection.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi rtsom pa dang / log par rtsom pa dang / rtsom pa gtong ba dang / rtsom pa la rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtsom pa dang / log par rtsom pa dang / rtsom pa gtong ba dang / rtsom pa la rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: non-initiation, mis-initiation, abandonment of initiation, and distraction in initiation.

original: de la mi rtsom pa'i gnyen por ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi rtsom pa'i gnyen por ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to not beginning is stated thus: “One should not give up the thought of awakening.”

original: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub la rtsol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtsom pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni byang chub la rtsol bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rtsom pa'i gnyen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The thought of awakening is the antidote to not beginning, because it is the effort for awakening.

original: log par rtsom pa'i gnyen por ni 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: log par rtsom pa'i gnyen por ni 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The antidote to false beginning is stated thus: “One should not give up the spiritual teacher.”

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni yang dag pa'i rtsom pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir te 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang 'khor ba'i gnyen po'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni yang dag pa'i rtsom pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir te 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang 'khor ba'i gnyen po'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: The spiritual teacher is the cause of correct beginning, because the spiritual teachers of the bodhisattva teach the Dharma that is the antidote to the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha paths and to saṃsāra.

original: de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams yin gyi de lta ma yin na ni mdza' bshes ngan pa rnams su 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams yin gyi de lta ma yin na ni mdza' bshes ngan pa rnams su 'gyur te ;
translated: Therefore, the spiritual teachers are spiritual friends, but if it were otherwise, they would be bad friends.

original: dper na bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i mdza' bshes ngan pa grogs ngan pa ste /
analyzed: dper na bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i mdza' bshes ngan pa grogs ngan pa ste /
translated: For example, these four are the bad friends, the bad companions of the bodhisattva:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa can bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can don nyung zhing bya ba nyung ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa gsang tshig gi spobs pa sna tshogs can zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa can bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa can don nyung zhing bya ba nyung ba dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa gsang tshig gi spobs pa sna tshogs can zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: those who are in the vehicle of the disciples, who are intent on their own welfare; those who are in the vehicle of the solitary sages, who have few duties and little activity; those who are sophists, who are skilled in the various arts; and those who are materialists, who are skilled in the various sciences.

original: rtsom pa gtong ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su gtong ba ste /
analyzed: rtsom pa gtong ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su gtong ba ste /
translated: Abandoning what one has begun is giving up the Thought of Awakening.

original: de'i gnyen por bzod pa dang / nges pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bzod pa dang / nges pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The remedy for that is stated in the verse: “One should not give up patience and certainty.”

original: bzod pa dang des pa med na grang ba la sogs pa las byung ba dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag gis gzir bar 'gyur na byang chub kyi sems yongs su gtong bar 'gyur bas rtsom pa gtong ba'i gnyen po ni bzod pa dang nges pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang des pa med na grang ba la sogs pa las byung ba dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag gis gzir bar 'gyur na byang chub kyi sems yongs su gtong bar 'gyur bas rtsom pa gtong ba'i gnyen po ni bzod pa dang nges pa'o //
translated: If one lacks patience and gentleness, one is tormented by the specific sufferings that arise from cold and so on, and from the harm of others.  One would then abandon the thought of awakening.  The remedy for abandoning the undertaking is patience and gentleness.

original: rtsom pa la rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rtsom pa la rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen por dgon pa la gnas pa yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The remedy for distraction in the undertaking is stated as not abandoning dwelling in the forest.

original: byang chub kyi sems yod du zin kyang lus kyi sems rnam par g-yengs na byang chub rtogs par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yod du zin kyang lus kyi sems rnam par g-yengs na byang chub rtogs par mi nus kyi /
translated: Even if one has the thought of awakening, if the mind is distracted by the body, one is not able to realize awakening.

original: yul yongs su btang bas dgon pa la dga' bar gyur na rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul yongs su btang bas dgon pa la dga' bar gyur na rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: But if one realizes the joy of dwelling in the forest by giving up objects, one will realize it.

original: dper na dgon par mngon par dgyes pa'i rgyal bas byang chub brnyes zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽yang @70a * //
analyzed: dper na dgon par mngon par dgyes pa'i rgyal bas byang chub brnyes zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽yang @70a * //
translated: For example, as it is said, “The Victorious One, who delights in the forest, attained awakening.”

original: byang chub kyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos bzhi ste /
translated: Four dharmas are conducive to the accumulation of enlightenment.

original: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir bzhi yin pas mi nyung mi mang ngo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir bzhi yin pas mi nyung mi mang ngo zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since these are the basis of those, they are neither less nor more.

original: byang chub kyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four dharmas conducive to the accumulation of enlightenment?

original: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa 'dod pa nyid dang / de 'thob pa dang ; de'i snod nyid dang / de sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa 'dod pa nyid dang / de 'thob pa dang ; de'i snod nyid dang / de sgrub pa'o //
translated: They are: the desire for instruction and further teaching, the attainment of that, the state of being a vessel for that, and the practice of that.

original: bzhi po de dag ni byang chub kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i rjes su mthun pa de sgrub par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni byang chub kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i rjes su mthun pa de sgrub par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: These four are conducive to the perfection that is the accumulation of enlightenment, and they accomplish that. This is the meaning.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa nyid kyi phyir yin te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa nyid kyi phyir yin te /
translated: Among them, not abandoning the thought of enlightenment is for the sake of instruction and further teaching,

original: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems ma btang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa nod par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems ma btang na byang chub sems dpa' rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa nod par 'dod de /
translated: because if the thought of enlightenment is not abandoned, bodhisattvas desire instruction and further teaching from spiritual friends.

original: dper na 'phags pa nor bzangs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa nor bzangs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the noble Sudhana.

original: de 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: de 'thob pa zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa 'thob pa ste /
translated: Attaining that means attaining instruction and counsel.

original: de yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas de gnyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten nas de gnyis 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is attained by relying on a spiritual friend, because those two are attained by that.

original: de'i snod nyid ces bya ba ni de gnyis kyi snod nyid de /
analyzed: de'i snod nyid ces bya ba ni de gnyis kyi snod nyid de /
translated: The receptivity to that is the receptivity to those two.

original: gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'i snod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'i snod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the receptivity to instruction and counsel.

original: de'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang des pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang des pa'o //
translated: The basis of that is patience and gentleness.

original: de'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa de gnyis sgrub ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de'i sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa de gnyis sgrub ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The practice of that is the practice of those two, instruction and counsel.

original: de'i gzhi ni dgon pa la gnas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni dgon pa la gnas pa la bya'o //
translated: The basis of that is living in the forest.

original: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang tshul khrims yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang tshul khrims yang dag par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That is the cause for accomplishing serenity, insight, and morality.

original: grong ni 'phral gyi bya ba mang ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: grong ni 'phral gyi bya ba mang ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: It is not because the village is full of many activities.

original: yang byang chub kyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub kyi tshogs dang mthun pa'i chos bzhi ste /
translated: There are four dharmas that are conducive to the requisites of enlightenment.

original: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir bzhi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir bzhi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The four bases of these are to be supplied here.

original: bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: don du gnyer ba nyid dang / thabs shes pa nyid dang / sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: don du gnyer ba nyid dang / thabs shes pa nyid dang / sgrub pa ste /
translated: They are aspiration, knowledge of means, and practice.

original: de la sgrub pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Practice is twofold:

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: the practice of bringing beings to maturity and the practice of bringing the qualities of buddhahood to maturity.

original: de la don du gnyer ba nyid kyi gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la don du gnyer ba nyid kyi gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: The basis of aspiration is not to abandon the thought of awakening.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas byang chub kyi sems btang ba dag ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas byang chub kyi sems btang ba dag ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who have abandoned the thought of awakening, whether they are śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas, do not aspire to the qualities of buddhahood.

original: thabs shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i thabs shes pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed pa'i thabs shes pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Knowledge of means is the knowledge of the means to attain buddhahood.

original: @70b de'i gzhi ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: @70b de'i gzhi ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: The basis of that is a spiritual teacher,

original: de las de thos par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las de thos par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one learns it from him.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa ste bshad do //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa ste bshad do //
translated: The practice is the practice called “perfection.”

original: de la sgrub pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the practice is twofold:

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: the practice of bringing beings to maturity and the practice of bringing the qualities of a buddha to maturity.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang nges pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang nges pa'o //
translated: The basis of the practice of bringing beings to maturity is patience and certainty.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i gzhi ni gzhan dgon pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i gzhi ni gzhan dgon pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: The basis of the practice of bringing the qualities of a buddha to maturity is dwelling in the forest.

original: sems can log par zhugs pa dag la mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can dang / 'du 'dzi la dga' bdag gis ni yongs su smin par byed pa gnyis sgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: sems can log par zhugs pa dag la mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can dang / 'du 'dzi la dga' bdag gis ni yongs su smin par byed pa gnyis sgrub par mi nus so //
translated: One who is impatient with beings who have entered wrong paths and who delights in society is incapable of practicing the two kinds of maturity.

original: yang byang chub kyi tshogs kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub kyi tshogs kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, there are four dharmas that are in conformity with the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir bzhi zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir bzhi zhes sbyar ro //
translated: They are called “the four bases” because they are the bases of those.

original: bzhi po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / de na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can sdud pa dang / brtson 'grus sbyangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / de na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can sdud pa dang / brtson 'grus sbyangs pa nyid do //
translated: not forsaking samsara, not being defiled by it, gathering sentient beings, and purifying effort.

original: de la 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'o //
translated: The basis of not forsaking samsara is not forsaking the spirit of enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni sangs rgyas nyid don du gnyer ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the spirit of enlightenment is the essence of striving for buddhahood.

original: de ni 'khor ba ji srid pa'i sems can gyi don la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba ji srid pa'i sems can gyi don la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is engaged in the welfare of living beings for as long as samsara lasts.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la sems bskyed pa gang yin pa de 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la sems bskyed pa gang yin pa de 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i gzhi ste /
translated: Or else, the spirit of enlightenment that is generated on the first bodhisattva stage is the basis of not forsaking samsara,

original: de la brten nas smon lam chen po bcu mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug par byed do //
analyzed: de la brten nas smon lam chen po bcu mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug par byed do //
translated: because on that basis one makes the ten great vows, which are fulfilled at the stage of buddhahood.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thug par gyur cig ces rgya che bar 'byung ba'o //🔽de ltar gyur na 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thug par gyur cig ces rgya che bar 'byung ba'o // de ltar gyur na 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ngo //
translated: The vast is the statement: May it reach the end of the realm of sentient beings.🔽 If it were otherwise, then cyclic life would be abandoned.

original: de na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba na'o //
analyzed: de na kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba na'o //
translated: The uncontaminated is in cyclic life.

original: de'i gzhi dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: de'i gzhi dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: The basis of that is the spiritual teacher,

original: de las kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i thabs 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i thabs 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because from him one obtains the means of becoming uncontaminated.

original: sems can sdud pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can sdud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can sdud pa zhes bya ba ni bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhi po dag gis sems can sdud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The attraction of sentient beings means the attraction of sentient beings by means of the four persuasions.

original: de'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang / nges pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang / nges pa ste /
translated: The basis of that is patience and certainty,

original: log par zhugs pa la ji mi snyam pa ni de dag sdud par mi byed do //
analyzed: log par zhugs pa la ji mi snyam pa ni de dag sdud par mi byed do //
translated: because one who is not indifferent to the wayward views does not attract them.

original: brtson 'grus sbyangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni brtson 'grus yongs su @71a * //🔽dag pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus sbyangs pa nyid ces bya ba ni brtson 'grus yongs su @71a * //🔽dag pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The purification of effort means the purification of effort.

original: dper na gser btso ma yongs su dag par smin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na gser btso ma yongs su dag par smin pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like well refined and purified gold.

original: dgon pa la gnas na brtson 'grus yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i gzhi ni dgon pa na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas na brtson 'grus yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i gzhi ni dgon pa na gnas pa'o //
translated: The basis for that is living in the forest, because one's effort becomes purified by living in the forest.

original: yang rgyu bzhi po dag gis bgrod dka' ba'i lam las rgal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang rgyu bzhi po dag gis bgrod dka' ba'i lam las rgal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Again, one crosses over the difficult path by means of four causes.

original: bzhi po gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: bzhi po gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What are the four?

original: de'i phyir 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, the desire to go, etc.

original: gang 'gro bar gyur ba dang / lam la mkhas pa dang / skom pa dang bkres pas yi chad pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / lam yongs su mi gtong bas bag yod par gyur ba ni de bgrod dka' ba'i lam las rgal bar byed pa'o /
analyzed: gang 'gro bar gyur ba dang / lam la mkhas pa dang / skom pa dang bkres pas yi chad pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / lam yongs su mi gtong bas bag yod par gyur ba ni de bgrod dka' ba'i lam las rgal bar byed pa'o /
translated: One who has gone, who is skilled in the path, who is indifferent to thirst and hunger, and who is heedful because of not abandoning the path, crosses over the difficult path.

original: de ltar na rgyu bzhi po de dag kho nas 'khor ba'i lam las rgal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu bzhi po de dag kho nas 'khor ba'i lam las rgal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one crosses over the path of cyclic existence by means of just these four causes.

original: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir chos bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi'i phyir chos bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: The four dharmas should be understood as the basis for those.

original: de la 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid kyi gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: de la 'gro bar 'dod pa nyid kyi gzhi ni byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: The basis of the desire to go is the thought of enlightenment.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'gro ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the cause of the bodhisattva's going in the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: lam shes pa nyid kyi gzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: lam shes pa nyid kyi gzhi ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: The basis of the knowledge of the path is the bodhisattva's spiritual teacher,

original: de la brten nas byang chub kyi lam shes pa nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas byang chub kyi lam shes pa nyid 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge of the path to enlightenment is attained in dependence on him.

original: yi chad pas ji mi snyam pa'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang des pa'o //
analyzed: yi chad pas ji mi snyam pa'i gzhi ni bzod pa dang des pa'o //
translated: The basis of indifference to discouragement is patience and gentleness.

original: de la yi chad pas ji mi snyam pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi mi bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de la yi chad pas ji mi snyam pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi mi bzlog pa'o //
translated: Indifference to discouragement is the non-reversal of suffering.

original: bzod pa dang des pa ni zhe mi sdang ba'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang des pa ni zhe mi sdang ba'o //
translated: Patience and gentleness are the non-hatred of that.

original: bag yod pa'i gzhi ni dgon pa na gnas pa ste de las de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag yod pa'i gzhi ni dgon pa na gnas pa ste de las de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of heedfulness is living in the forest, because that is the accomplishment of that.

original: ci'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu brtson pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu brtson pa la byang chub sems dpa' zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is one who strives for the enlightenment of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha not called a bodhisattva?

original: ltag na med pa nyid du ming rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ltag na med pa nyid du ming rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the name is established as not being higher.

original: snang byed bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snang byed bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like a glowworm,

original: 'di skad du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu brtson pa'i sems can yod du zin kyang ltag na med pa ma yin pa'i phyir de byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la rab tu brtson pa'i sems can yod du zin kyang ltag na med pa ma yin pa'i phyir de byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin te /
translated: this is what is taught: although there are sentient beings who strive for the enlightenment of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha, they are not bodhisattvas because they are not higher.

original: ltag na med par mi snang bar gzhag par mthong ba 'di lta ste /🔽snang byed bzhin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltag na med par mi snang bar gzhag par mthong ba 'di lta ste / snang byed bzhin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is seen that they are established as not appearing higher, like🔽a glowworm.

original: srin bu me khyer la sogs pa yang snang bar mi byed pa ma yin mod kyi snang byed dag ces mi bya ste /
analyzed: srin bu me khyer la sogs pa yang snang bar mi byed pa ma yin mod kyi snang byed dag ces mi bya ste /
translated: Although fireflies and so on also do not illuminate, they are not called illuminators.

original: 'dir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin no //
translated: Here it is the same.🔽In brief, the meaning is this.

original: don mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni de ltar re zhig rgya cher bshad @71b pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni de ltar re zhig rgya cher bshad @71b pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, in brief, the meaning is this.

original: don mdor bsdu na bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde 'dir theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i las dang / ji ltar de'i 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba de yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba de la rjes su mthun pa'i las ni mdo tshig gong ma rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: don mdor bsdu na bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde 'dir theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i las dang / ji ltar de'i 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba de yongs su bstan to zhes bya ba de la rjes su mthun pa'i las ni mdo tshig gong ma rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: The action that is suitable is taught by the above passages of the sutra.

original: las de'i 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba ni mdo'i tshig tha mas bstan te /
analyzed: las de'i 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ba ni mdo'i tshig tha mas bstan te /
translated: The non-loss of the result of that action is taught by the final passage of the sutra.

original: dgon pa la gnas na sems rtse gcig tu byed nus pas las de'i 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgon pa la gnas na sems rtse gcig tu byed nus pas las de'i 'bras bu med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one dwells in the wilderness, one is able to make the mind one-pointed, so the result of that action will not be lost.

original: 'phags pa chos bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa rgya cher 'grel ba /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa rgya cher 'grel ba /
translated: The Commentary on the Noble Four Dharmas

original: slob dpon ye shes byin gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon ye shes byin gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: by Master Jñānadatta is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po d'a na sh'i la dang / pradzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po d'a na sh'i la dang / pradzny'a warma dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa//
translated: The Indian scholars Dānaśīla and Prajñāvarman and the chief editor and translator Bandé Yeshé Dé translated, edited, and finalized it.

original: * // ga ya mgo'i ri'i rnam par bshad pa bzhugs so //
analyzed: * // ga ya mgo'i ri'i rnam par bshad pa bzhugs so //
translated: The Explanation of the Gayā Head Mountain
